Parameters: Hormone & Metabolite Concentrations (e.g., Blood Glucose, Ammonia, Insulin, Glucagon)

ControlLogic: ATP/AMP Ratio: High -> Synthesis/Storage; Low -> Energy Generation
Phase I Product Polarity Insufficient: Trigger Phase II Conjugation (Glucuronidation, Sulfation, etc.)
Biliary Pathway Patent: Trigger Excretion via Bile
Output: Water-soluble, Non-toxic Metabolites (via Blood or Bile)

ControlLogic: Osmotic Pressure/Plasma Protein Level Low: Trigger Albumin Synthesis
Coagulation Cascade Activated: Trigger Clotting Factor Synthesis (Prothrombin, VII, IX, X)
Cholesterol Surplus: Trigger Bile Acid and Bile Salt Synthesis
Specific Hormone Signals (e.g., Estrogen): Trigger Carrier Protein Synthesis

Input: Ammonia (from Amino Acid Degradation, Gut Bacteria)
ControlLogic: ([Ammonia]blood > Threshold_toxic): Activate Urea Cycle to form non-toxic Urea
ATP Supply Adequate: Urea Cycle is ATP-dependent
Amino Acid Catabolism Active: Provide NH3 and Aspartate
Endocrine Receptor Activation: Regulate downstream metabolic pathways
Inflammatory Signal Activation (Cytokine Increase): Trigger Acute Phase Protein Synthesis (CRP, SAA)
Nerve Signal (e.g., Sympathetic Excitation): Trigger Short-term Glycogenolysis
Output: Cytokine Receptor Signal Transduction Products (Internal effect)
